channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Storm Goretti live: rail services suspended, flights cancelled and schools closed across UK as 380,000 homes in France lose power
item.description: Road, rail and air travel disrupted across the UK as Storm Goretti brings wind, rain and snow to the UK and parts of Europe Tell us: how have you been...

item.title: Starmer warned of £28bn defence funding shortfall by head of UK military – UK politics live
item.description: Prime minister expected to order fresh overhaul of defence investment plan, already delayed from expected autumn release Reform UK’s “flagship” local ...

item.title: Russia says US has released two tanker crew members as Kyiv calls for stronger action against ‘shadow fleet’ – Europe live
item.description: Moscow thanks US for release of crew of ship seized earlier this week, after Zelenskyy calls for ‘clear reaction’ from world after heavy overnight str...

item.title: Trump claims to have cancelled ‘previously expected’ second wave of attacks on Venezuela – US politics live
item.description: US president says move was reaction to Caracas releasing large numbers of political prisoners as ‘sign of seeking peace’ The US Supreme court could is...

item.title: UK ministers considering leaving X amid concern over AI tool images
item.description: Labour party chair says government having conversations about use of platform in light of sexualised Grok images UK politics live – latest updates UK ...

item.title: Winning in England will be Australia's next goal - McGrath column
item.description: After a comfortable 4-1 series win in the Ashes, Australia's next goal will be winning in England for the first time in 26 years when they tour next s...

item.title: Venezuelan government begins releasing political prisoners
item.description: The US, which recently captured its President Nicolás Maduro, has long demanded the detainees be freed.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X limits Grok AI image editing after outcry over sexualised deepfakes
item.description: It comes after government urged Ofcom to use all its powers – up to and including an effective ban – against X.

item.title: Businesses call to be included in any pub rates backtrack
item.description: Shops, pharmacies and music venues want any climbdown on business rates for pubs to apply to them too.

item.title: 'My best is yet to come' - Semenyo joins Man City in £65m deal
item.description: Manchester City sign Ghana winger Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth on a contract until 2031.
